name: Aria Disconnect Demo
description:
(THIS DEMO WILL BE AVAILABLE ON STEAM ANY DAY SOON, BE SURE TO WISHLIST ARIA DISCONNECT THERE  )

Aria Disconnect on steam

Aria Disconnect is a ~16-bit action, adventure platformer a.k.a Metroidvania with

a big touch of cyberpunk, You are the Protagonist Heri, a tech engineer.

You are going to follow Heris journey to recover from the digital nightmare he

has become stuck inside. The year is 2082, you are hooked to a machine, and

there is only one way out, to disconnect.

Items

Health medium

• Gives health points

Psy medium

• Gives Psy points

GLOBAL BUTTONS

(Only when in game start menu)

Control/CTRL= quickload  from the latest savefile.

SPACEBAR = Quick start game to  intro cutscene .

Escape = End Game

Delete = Restart Game

TAB = Fullscreen

Movement

(The gamepad and keyboard legens can be found when you open the equipment menu and press M on the keyboard or Select on the gamepad)

KEYBOARD

Move = WASD

Jump/Accept = K

Attack = J

Dash(Upgrade)/Cancel = L

Open Equipment Menu = U

Open Ring Menu = M

Backdash = O

Gamepads

XBOX

Move = DPAD or Left Anlog Stick

Jump/Accept = A

Attack  = X

Dash(Upgrade)/Cancel = B

Open Equipment Menu = START

Open Ring Menu = SELECT

Backdash = R Trigger

8BITDO/SNES

Move = DPAD or Left Anlog Stick

Jump/Accept = B

Attack  = Y

Dash(Upgrade)/Cancel = A

Open Equipment Menu = START

Open Ring Menu = SELECT

Backdash = R Trigger

PLAYSTATION

Move = DPAD or Left Anlog Stick

Jump/Accept = CROSS  X

Attack  = SQUARE □

Dash(Upgrade)/Cancel = CIRCLE O

Open Equipment Menu = START

Open Ring Menu = SELECT

Backdash = R Trigger

HEADS UP

• Graphics, Music, SFX are not final, so they are a subject for change still.

KNOWN ISSUES

• The game only accepts X-Input controllers at the moment. So the Playstation controller is not working yet due to how Game Maker works with controller inputs.

• Some graphical glitches regarding the main character

• The Zoom in after the boss does not go back to fully normal, and this will be checked up on

• Enemies can get stuck into walls and will not behave 100% as intended, yet.

• Changing to fullscreen mode in the middle of cutscenes can make the aspect ratio look weird on the game

If you find any other bugs, i would really appreciate if you reported them!
